sn6.7:1.2: Now on that occasion the Blessed One had gone for his day’s abiding and was in seclusion.
sn6.7:1.3: Then the independent brahmās Subrahmā and Suddhāvāsa approached the Blessed One and stood one at each doorpost.
sn6.7:1.4: Then, referring to the bhikkhu Kokālika, the independent brahmā Subrahmā recited this verse in the presence of the Blessed One:
sn6.7:2.1: An immeasurable one by taking his measure?
sn6.7:2.2: “What wise man here would seek to define
sn6.7:2.3: He who would measure an immeasurable one
sn6.7:2.4: Must be, I think, an obstructed worldling. ʺ
